TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class TemplateControl : System.Web.UI.Control, System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService, System.Web.UI.INamingContainer
.class public auto ansi abstract TemplateControl extends System.Web.UI.Control implements class System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService, class System.Web.UI.INamingContainer

Docs.summary: Provides the class and the class with a base set of functionality.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The TemplateControl class is an abstract class that provides common properties and methods for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class and the <xref:System.Web.UI.UserControl> class. A new instance of the TemplateControl is not created directly.
The TemplateControl class defines methods supporting declarative data-binding expressions:
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.Eval%2A> method for data-binding expression involving data sources, such as simple properties or expressions.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.XPath%2A> method for parsing and evaluating an XPath data-binding expression.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.XPathSelect%2A> method for data-binding against an expression containing an XPath select statement. The result is a node collection that implements the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
For more information on data-binding expression, see [Data-Binding Expression Syntax](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/676beb1d-ddfa-4153-bba8-3c86dcb7ceca) and [Binding to Databases](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/ab7b2846-975b-4057-a948-45527497c742).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to derive a control named `MyControl` from the TemplateControl class and override the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.Construct%2A> method. When `MyControl` is initialized, the overridden <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.Construct%2A> method is called.
[!code-vb[TemplateControl_Sample1#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.template_2_1.vb)] [!code-cs[TemplateControl_Sample1#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.template_2_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public event EventHandler AbortTransaction;
.event class System.EventHandler AbortTransaction

Docs.summary: Occurs when a user ends a transaction.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to register a custom event handler for the AbortTransaction event. Because <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl> is an abstract class, this code example uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class, which is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl> class. `Account` is a class that supports a `Debit` operation, which is transactional and must execute as a unit. If any exception is raised during this operation, the transaction is ended.
[!code-vb[TemplateControl_OnCommitTransaction#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e-system.web.ui.template_0_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[TemplateControl_OnCommitTransaction#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e-system.web.ui.template_0_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public string AppRelativeVirtualPath { get; set; }
.property instance string AppRelativeVirtualPath

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the application-relative, virtual directory path to the file from which the control is parsed and compiled.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the file that defines a <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl> control resides in a directory other than that of the page processing the request, use the AppRelativeVirtualPath property to return the application-relative, virtual path to the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.AppRelativeTemplateSourceDirectory%2A> property is set based on the virtual path that is set in the AppRelativeVirtualPath property.

Docs.exception: The path that is set is .
The path that is set is not rooted.

MemberSignature.Value: public event EventHandler CommitTransaction;

Docs.summary: Occurs when a transaction completes.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to register a custom event handler for the CommitTransaction event. Because <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl> is an abstract class, this code example uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class, which is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl> class. `Account` is a class that supports a `Debit` operation, which is transactional and must execute as a unit. If any exception is raised during this operation, the transaction is ended.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool EnableTheming { get; set; }
.property instance bool EnableTheming

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether themes apply to the control that is derived from the class.
Docs.value: to use themes; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The EnableTheming property indicates whether themes are enabled for the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl> class. When the EnableTheming property is `true`, the theme directory for the application is searched for control skins to apply. If no skin for the particular control exists in the theme directory, skins are not applied.

MemberSignature.Value: protected object Eval (string expression);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig instance object Eval(string expression) cil managed

Docs.param: The navigation path from the container to the public property value to place in the bound control property.
Docs.summary: Evaluates a data-binding expression.
Docs.returns: An object that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value of `expression` must evaluate to a public property.
The Eval method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBinder.Eval%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.GetDataItem%2A> method to resolve the object reference that the expression is evaluated against.

Docs.exception: The data-binding method can be used only for controls contained on a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Application-level resources are stored in the App_GlobalResources folder. For more information, see [Resources in ASP.NET Applications](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/5a29f26b-d94d-48d9-864e-5ee8890dc265).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the GetGlobalResourceObject method to access a string named `GlobalResourceString1` from a global resource named `MyResource.resx` in the App_GlobalResources folder. The `className` parameter is `MyResource` without the .resx extension.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.TemplateControl_GetResources#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/90ee8bc8-58c8-4fc1-8312-_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.TemplateControl_GetResources#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/90ee8bc8-58c8-4fc1-8312-_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Web.UI.Control LoadControl (string virtualPath);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Web.UI.Control LoadControl(string virtualPath) cil managed

Docs.param: The virtual path to a control file.
Docs.summary: Loads a object from a file based on a specified virtual path.
Docs.returns: Returns the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the control supports caching, the object returned from the LoadControl method is not actually a <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> object; rather, it is a <xref:System.Web.UI.PartialCachingControl> object. If the `virtualPath` parameter is relative, the path of the loaded control is relative to the path of the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl>.
When you load a control into a container control, the container raises all of the added control's events until it has caught up to the current event. However, the added control does not catch up with postback data processing. For an added control to participate in postback data processing, including validation, the control must be added in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Init> event rather than in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Load> event.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the LoadControl method to add a user control to an ASP.NET page.
In the `OnInit` event method, this page uses the LoadControl method to programmatically create a user control on the page. The method adds the control to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PlaceHolder> Web server control named `Placeholder1`.
For the definition of the `MyControl` class that is used in this code example, see <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl>.
[!code-cs[TemplateControl_Sample1#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.template_0_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[TemplateControl_Sample1#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.template_0_1.aspx)]

Docs.exception: The virtual path is or empty.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Web.UI.Control LoadControl (Type t, object[] parameters);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Web.UI.Control LoadControl(class System.Type t, object[] parameters) cil managed

Docs.param: The type of the control.

An array of arguments that match in number, order, and type the parameters of the constructor to invoke. If `parameters` is an empty array or , the constructor that takes no parameters (the default constructor) is invoked.
Docs.summary: Loads a object based on a specified type and constructor parameters.
Docs.returns: Returns the specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the user control supports caching, the object returned from the LoadControl method is not actually a <xref:System.Web.UI.UserControl> object; rather, it is a <xref:System.Web.UI.PartialCachingControl> object.
When you load a control into a container control, the container raises all of the added control's events until it has caught up to the current event. However, the added control does not catch up with postback data processing. For an added control to participate in postback data processing, including validation, the control must be added in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Init> event rather than in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Load> event.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Web.UI.Control ParseControl (string content);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Web.UI.Control ParseControl(string content) cil managed

Docs.param: A string that contains a user control.
Docs.summary: Parses an input string into a object on the Web Forms page or user control.
Docs.returns: The parsed .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `content` parameter contains a user control, such as you would find in an .ascx file. This string cannot contain any code, because the ParseControl method never causes compilation.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> Web server control using the ParseControl method, and then adds the result to the <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PlaceHolder> Web server control named `myPlaceholder`.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.ParseControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.template_7_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.ParseControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.template_7_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Web.UI.Control ParseControl (string content, bool ignoreParserFilter);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Web.UI.Control ParseControl(string content, bool ignoreParserFilter) cil managed

Docs.param: A string that contains a user control.
A value that specifies whether to ignore the parser filter.
Docs.summary: Parses an input string into a object on the ASP.NET Web page or user control.
Docs.returns: The parsed control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `content` parameter contains a user control (the contents of an .ascx file). This string cannot contain any code, because the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.ParseControl%2A> method never causes compilation.
The `ignoreParserFilter` parameter allows the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> class to be ignored. The <xref:System.Web.UI.PageParserFilter> class is used by the ASP.NET parser to determine whether an item is allowed in the page at parse time.

MemberSignature.Value: int IFilterResolutionService.CompareFilters (string filter1, string filter2);
.method hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService.CompareFilters(string filter1, string filter2) cil managed

Docs.param: A device filter name.
A device filter name.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether a parent/child relationship exists between two specified device filters.
Docs.returns: 1, if is a parent of ; -1, if is a parent of ; otherwise, 0, if there is no parent/child relationship between and .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The IFilterResolutionService.CompareFilters method is part of the <xref:System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService> interface, which is specific to how a control uses device filters in a designer environment. When controls are parsed or persisted in the designer environment outside the context of a browser request, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService> provides a way to determine if the current control is affected by a named filter and whether a named filter is part of a specific device-filter hierarchy.

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the specified filter is a type of the current filter object.
Docs.returns: if the specified filter is a type applicable to the current filter object; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The IFilterResolutionService.EvaluateFilter method is part of the <xref:System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService> interface, which is specific to how a control uses device filters in a designer environment. When controls are parsed or persisted in the designer environment outside the context of a browser request, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService> provides a way to determine if the current control is affected by a named filter and whether a named filter is part of a specific device-filter hierarchy.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The TestDeviceFilter method invokes the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.IsBrowser%2A> method. For more information on device filtering, see [Device Filtering Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.returns: An object that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The XPath method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.XPathBinder.Eval%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.GetDataItem%2A> method to resolve the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable> object reference that the expression is evaluated against.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the XPath method in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Repeater> control.
[!code-vb[System.Web.UI.TemplateControl_XPath1#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.template_3_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.TemplateControl_XPath1#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.template_3_1.aspx)]
The following test XML data can be used in the preceding code example.
``` <contacts> <contact id="1"> <name>contact name 1</name> <note>contact note 1</note> </contact> <contact id="2"> <name>contact name 2</name> <note>contact note 2</note> </contact> </contacts> ```

Docs.exception: The data-binding method can be used only for controls contained on a .
